intro: Erigeron poliospermus var. cereus, commonly known as the Desert Blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves and a deep root system to conserve water. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant's structure and morphology reflect its evolutionary adaptations to survive in harsh, dry climates.
